CLUE: Apt or witty remark - in France
OUTPUT: ['"I\'m from Paris, but I bring my own bread."', '"A good joke is like a baguette: it should be long and satisfying."', '"The Eiffel Tower isn’t just for champagne; it\'s a reminder to savor life\'s moments."', '"In France, you don\'t wait for the perfect moment; you create it with croissants in hand."', '"French people have good taste - they say so after every meal and wine pairing."', '"They speak French, but to truly understand them, listen to their witty banter over a café au lait."', '"In France, the secret ingredient in life isn\'t just love; it\'s also \'la joie de vivre.\'"', '"French wisdom doesn’t always come from books; sometimes, it comes with a side of escargot and an explanation."', '"When you hear \'Bonjour,\' smile as if the world is your canvas and life\'s brushes are ready for action."', '"The French art of conversation doesn\'t just include talking; it includes listening to the clinking glasses, too."', '"French fashion isn\'t just about clothes—it’s an attitude that turns heads even in a quiet village square."', '"In France, you don\'t need to be fluent in French to appreciate its subtle charm; it\'s as welcoming as a warm baguette and rich wine."', '"French wit is like their cheese—it gets better with age (and a good story)."', '"The beauty of the French language lies not just in its words, but also in the pauses that give them meaning."', '"A true Parisian knows how to walk down the street and make every step count – much like their carefully crafted pastries."', '"French cuisine is an art form; it\'s not just about feeding your stomach, but also painting a picture of culture on your palate."', '"The French may say \'joie de vivre,\' but they live it through their love for fine food and wine that tells tales of the earth itself."', '"In France, even an empty plate at lunch is cause for celebration – because you\'ve had time to enjoy each morsel in good company."', '"French humor? It\'s not just about punchlines; it\'s a full meal of laughter that leaves everyone feeling satisfied."', '"The French have mastered the art of living, much like they\'ve perfected their cuisine – with equal parts passion and perfection."']
